summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Atlas Shrugged: Part One
Review Date: 2015/03/12
Store: Patrick Fischler  (Actor),     Taylor Schilling  (Actor)    Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Ayn Rand\'s timeless novel of\xa0rational self-interest\xa0comes to life for a new millennium.". The year is 2016, and America is on the verge of economic disaster. The greatest citizens are being targeted, and dark forces are working to bring about America’s final days. Our only hope for salvation lies with Dagny Taggart and Henry Rearden, rugged individualists whose bold ideas may have the power to spark a revolution and reclaim to the American Dream.', 'Amazon.com', 'After years of trying, somebody finally made a film out of Ayn Rand\'s big-selling novel of "rational self-interest,"', 'Atlas Shrugged', '. Well, got a start on it, anyway, with this 2011 release of', 'Part One', "(of three). The sprawling novel is necessarily telescoped down to size, and the focus is on railroad magnate Dagny Taggart (Taylor Schilling) and her intricate strategies involving a piece of real estate in Colorado, an ongoing economic collapse, and the rugged individualist, Hank Rearden (Grant Bowler), whose new metal alloy might come in handy for laying new track. Of course, the real issue in Rand's scenario is not metal alloy but the fact that government regulation and a misguided sense of collectivism and altruism is strangling the elite members of society, something the movie reminds us of with grim regularity. As a kind of boardroom-plotting movie,", 'Atlas Shrugged', 'isn\'t incompetent, and if director Paul Johansson hasn\'t devised a way to make these heavy-handed discussions come to life, at least it keeps moving along. If you like Rand\'s objectivist philosophy, you\'ll bask in the glow of having those ideas reaffirmed, and if you\'re uninitiated, well, they certainly are laid out there in stark fashion. (And if you find Rand\'s ideas absurd, you\'ll find this movie a little like watching a cult meeting.) As to the question "Who is John Galt?" you\'ll have to move on to', 'Atlas Shrugged: Part Two', ", released in 2012, to pick that up--but be ready to work at sorting the plot out anew, because Part One's cast has been replaced by a new roster of actors.", '--Robert Horton']
Average Rating: 4.1
Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.3 x 7.5 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '22914266', 'Director': 'Paul Johansson', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 37 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 8, 2011', 'Actors': 'Patrick Fischler, Taylor Schilling, Grant Bowler, Matthew Marsden, Edi Gathegi', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Harmon M. Kaslow, John Aglialoro', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Atlas Shrugged is one of the best novels ever written. The movie is one of the worst ever filmed- a combination of bad acting, bad script and missing the true idea of Ayn Rand's pro-capitolistic message - if Ayn Rand were alive, she'd probably cringe....then write an insightful piece on how terrible this movie is.
Review Title: Big disappointment
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Modern Family
Review Date: 2015/03/27
Categories: Comedy
Product Description: ["Today's American families come in all shapes and sizes. Just ask these three families. One is a traditional family with a working dad, homemaker mom and their two kids; one is a gay couple who have just adopted an Asian baby and the third is an older man married to a much younger Latina woman. Shot from the perspective of an unseen documentary filmmaker, this comedy takes a modern look at the complications that come with being a family in 2009."]
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Gail Mancuso', 'Steven Levitan', 'Beth McCarthy-Miller', 'Michael Spiller', 'Jason Winer', 'James R. Bagdonas', 'James Alan Hensz', 'Fred Savage', 'Chris Koch', 'Jeffrey Walker']}
Review Text: I usually do not review movies and TV shows because it's subjective whether you like it or not but this show totally makes me LOL!
Review Title: ... movies and TV shows because it's subjective whether you like it or not but this show totally makes me ...
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/04/10
Average Rating: 3.6
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Eoin Moore', 'Edward Berger', 'Christian von Castelberg'], 'Producers': ['Filmpool Film und Fernsehproduktion'], 'Starring': ['Charly Hubner', 'Anneke Kim Sarnau', 'Uwe Preuss'], 'Studio': ['MHz Networks']}
Review Text: Love this series! Great acting, drama and film quality. Some of the translated subtitles are a little of but not bad.
Review Title: Great crime series
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/06/09
Average Rating: 3.6
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Eoin Moore', 'Alexander Dierbach', 'Rene Heisig', 'Thomas Stiller'], 'Producers': ['Filmpool Film und Fernsehproduktion'], 'Starring': ['Charly Hubner', 'Anneke Kim Sarnau', 'Josef Heynert'], 'Studio': ['MHz Networks']}
Review Text: Great series- hope there's a Bukow & Konig 3!! Great acting, plot, suspense...very engaging.
Review Title: Highly recommend this crime drama!
Rating: 5.0

Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Lee Shallat Chemel', 'Phil Traill', 'Elliot Hegarty', 'Blake T. Review Text: This show used to be funny but it isn't anymore. It seems as though the writers ran out of ideas. Too bad because the first few seasons were great.
Review Title: Used to be funny, now it is boring
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: What's Your Number?
Review Date: 2017/01/31
Categories: Comedy, Romance, Passionate, Strange
Product Description: ['HD. Anna Faris is a ditzy blonde who decides to track down her 20 exes to see if she missed out on Mr. Right.']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mark Mylod'], 'Producers': ['Kathy Busby', 'Gitty Daneshvari', 'Anna Faris', 'Beau Flynn', 'Daryl Freimark', 'Jordana Glick-Franzheim', 'Nan Morales', 'Tripp Vinson'], 'Starring': ['Anna Faris', 'Chris Evans', 'Ari Graynor']}
Review Text: Predictable but sweet.
Review Title: Four Stars
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Date: 2019/05/29
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Starring': ['Christine Baranski', 'Rose Leslie', 'Cush Jumbo']}
Review Text: No matter how much you dislike President Trump, the relentless storyline that bashes him in every episode becomes a bore. The acting is terrific but the show is on a steep decline as the Trump-pummeling becomes more and more ridiculous ...and unrealistic. Season one drew you in but season three is a big yawn
Review Title: New script writers please!
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------

prompt:
Based on this purchase history, analyze and summarize this person's genuine preferences and patterns in under 256 words. Think step by step:

    1. First, identify consistent patterns in ratings and sentiments
    2. Next, observe common themes across product purposes and use cases
    3. Then, note recurring quality preferences and price sensitivity patterns
    4. Finally, synthesize these observations into core preferences

    Remember to:
    - Focus only on keywords and  trends supported by multiple interactions
    - Avoid repeating specific product names or details
    - Base conclusions strictly on the provided purchase data

    Here's the purchase data:

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual's purchase history reveals a clear preference for quality, engaging narratives across movie and TV genres, particularly in comedy and dramatic series. Ratings demonstrate a tendency to value strong acting and compelling plots, as evidenced by high ratings for shows that deliver these elements. Sentiment analysis shows significant disappointment when quality diminishes, as seen in the negative feedback for underwhelming adaptations and declining series.

Common themes include a strong appreciation for thought-provoking material, particularly narratives that explore societal dynamics, as highlighted by the engagement with philosophically driven content. Favorable reviews indicate a preference for humor and relatable family stories, signaling enjoyment of lighthearted yet meaningful content.

Quality preferences lean towards well-executed productions with solid storytelling, while price sensitivity is not explicitly noted but implied through varying ratings; lower-rated products generally correlate with unmet expectations. The individual seems to gravitate towards media that balances entertainment with intellectual stimulation, showing distinct discontent for works that fail to uphold original thematic intentions or quality over time. Overall, this person values media that resonates emotionally and intellectually, while exhibiting strong reactions to perceived declines in quality and creative direction.

target_interaction.title: Great acting, great script, great scenery...
target_interaction.text: This show has it all- great cast, beautiful location... and it holds your interest. I hope there are more episodes in the future!
